diagnosis: Visual hierarchy is weak: Headlines and body text have insufficient size/weight contrast. H2 elements need stronger differentiation from body copy.
Trust signals are minimal: No client logos above-the-fold, no certifications, no testimonial photos with real attribution.
Generic iconography: Emoji icons (ü§ñüìä‚öôÔ∏è) feel casual for enterprise. Replace with professional SVG icon set or custom illustrations.
Inconsistent spacing: Some sections have irregular vertical rhythm. Establish 8px base grid system.
CTA prominence is low: Primary buttons don't stand out enough. Increase size, add subtle shadows, and ensure sufficient whitespace around them.
Limited social proof in hero: No client count, no recognizable logo strip, no above-the-fold credibility indicators.
Placeholder images weaken credibility: 'Company Image' and 'Blog Image' placeholders reduce professional appearance.
Footer lacks depth: Missing comprehensive sitemap, social links, certifications, and privacy/security badges.
Animation overuse: Floating emoji animations feel gimmicky. Keep animations purposeful and subtle.
Color palette needs expansion: Single primary blue limits visual interest. Add complementary accent colors for hierarchy.

accessibilityChecklist: Color contrast: Ensure 4.5:1 for body text, 3:1 for large text (18px+ or 14px+ bold). Test with WebAIM Contrast Checker. Current primary-500 (#373e98) on white passes.
Reduced motion: Wrap all animations in @media (prefers-reduced-motion: reduce) { /* disable or simplify */ }. AnimatedStatCard already respects this.
Focus indicators: All interactive elements need visible focus states. Use focus-visible:ring-2 focus-visible:ring-primary-500 focus-visible:ring-offset-2.
Keyboard navigation: All CTAs, links, and interactive cards must be keyboard accessible. Test with Tab key. Add tabindex='0' to custom interactive elements.
ARIA labels: Buttons with icons need aria-label. Images need descriptive alt text. Use aria-hidden='true' on decorative elements.
Heading hierarchy: Use semantic HTML (h1 ‚Üí h6) in logical order. Only one h1 per page. Current site has proper hierarchy.
Skip to content: Add skip link for keyboard users: Skip to main content
Lazy loading: Add loading='lazy' to all images below the fold (already implemented). Use Intersection Observer for complex components.
LCP optimization: Preload hero video and above-the-fold images. Add <link rel='preload' as='video' href='/hero-video.mp4'> to <head>. Current LCP likely the video.
Touch targets: Ensure minimum 44√ó44px for all interactive elements (WCAG 2.5.5). Current CTAs use py-4 px-8 which meets this.

integrationNotes.reactBitsInstallation: React Bits does not provide clear npm installation or import paths from public documentation. RECOMMENDED APPROACH: Use custom implementations provided in codeSnippets. If React Bits becomes available, integration would likely be: npm install reactbits, import { Component } from 'reactbits', and follow their docs for Tailwind configuration.
integrationNotes.customComponentApproach: All animation needs can be met with provided custom components: AnimatedStatCard, ScrollReveal, StaggeredGrid, SkeletonList. These use native React hooks (useState, useEffect, useRef) and Intersection Observer API.
integrationNotes.tailwindIntegration: Extend tailwind.config.js with design tokens provided. Example: module.exports = { theme: { extend: { colors: { primary: { 50: '#f0f1f9', 500: '#373e98', ... } }, fontFamily: { heading: ['Inter', 'sans-serif'], body: ['Lora', 'serif'] }, spacing: { section: { sm: '64px', md: '96px', lg: '128px' } } } } }
integrationNotes.performanceOptimization: 1) Lazy load all below-fold images with loading='lazy'. 2) Use Intersection Observer for scroll animations (already implemented). 3) Preload critical assets (hero video, fonts) in <head>. 4) Code-split routes with React.lazy() and Suspense. 5) Compress images (already done: 11MB ‚Üí 266KB).
integrationNotes.motionAccessibility: Wrap all animations in: const prefersReducedMotion = window.matchMedia('(prefers-reduced-motion: reduce)').matches; if (prefersReducedMotion) { /* skip animation */ }. Or use CSS: @media (prefers-reduced-motion: reduce) { * { animation-duration: 0.01ms !important; transition-duration: 0.01ms !important; } }
integrationNotes.deploymentChecklist: 1) Run npm run build and test dist/ locally. 2) Check Lighthouse scores (aim for 90+ on all metrics). 3) Test on real devices (iOS Safari, Android Chrome). 4) Verify all API endpoints return expected data shapes. 5) Enable gzip/brotli compression on server. 6) Set cache headers for static assets (images, fonts, JS, CSS).
